content:
9, 2014
												Now, before anything, I hate 3rd party DRM. Steam is enough, we don't want your turd client bloating our computers. Ok Trion? As good as this game is, Glyph is poo and you know it is. Also hot diggity damn the patches are big, so be aware of that before you decide you want to play this. This game follows a TV show on SyFy, and it is a really good show and you should watch it, but you may be thinking, is the game as good? And the answer is yes! I would venture to say that the game is better, because you have more stuff to do, and you can explore the world that you see in the show, and you can do quests that go together with the show.This game is an MMO, and that means there are a lot of people in the server with you, and they can help you complete missions because they have the missions too, which is awesome and its a mechanic that makes this game sometimes. You are not just running around killing stuff by yourself you are running around killing stuff with a random person, it makes an otherwise empty world feel alive, which is awesome. There is also something cool about seeing someone fly down the road in the opposite direction while driving alone, its a little thing, but I love it.The theme mainly has to do with Mutants to start with, and it is fun shooting and looting alone, but with a friend it is even better. This game does take a while to download though, but I think it is worth the wait. You are a Ark Hunter, who was implanted with an EGO device, which is sort of like Cortana. And you are on a ship, and it crashes. And you have to help with everything. Not going into anymore detail as not to spoil it.I think this game succeeded in making it feel like a single player game if you want it to be, but still being an MMO, which is rare, because you don't have to be in a huge party to do anything, which is great for someone with major social anxiety like me ;)I am surprised that the game is still good after it went F2P, I expected P2W everywhere, but luckily, we didn't get that, and I am thankful. You can still buy different versions of the game ranging from 20-100 dollars, which I would never do, the game is fine in normal state, and you can just buy the DLC if you really want too. Which I have no opinion on since I don't own the DLC.I don't like MMOs as a general rule, but I am in love with this game. It has it faults, but everything does. I give this a 8.75/10 The Deductions are as follows:-The Client feels unnecessary and almost like bloatware.-The game can lag, and kick you off, making you reload which can be annoying mid mission.-It made me lonely.

content:
17
												I play this because friends play this.  Period.As an RPG it has little in common with the TV series other than some names, races, and a couple of characters.  As an RPG it pretty much totally lacks immersion.In terms of design flaws;The GUI is poorly designed and needs an overhaul.There are WAY too many forms of currency. In-game communication with other party members and/or players is horrid.   The game even periodically breaks your team/group without notice.  Occasionally, you get sent to a server other than your friends/team/group, without notice.  So even though you are technically at the same event or mission, you can't see or help each other because you are in reality - on a different server.  I traded with another player once, I still couldn't tell you how we did it (The GUI is THAT bad). Server connections are gawd-awful!  Frequently at well attended arc falls/events, all the players and/or mobs will completely disappear.  It doesn't matter if other players can revive you if you get KO'd, because they can't see you and don't know that you are down.  You can't get a decent group score or loot, because you can't see the mobs to shoot at them.Mission/quest tracking is terrible.  NPC dialogue is looped which not only breaks immersion, but gets really annoying after the first 2-3 loops of the same dialogue.  Scotty frequently beams mobs in and out of your location from deep space!!!  Yes! You are standing there and all of a sudden *POOF* you are in the middle of the enemy camp!  Heading for that ammo chest to re-stock on ammo?  *POOF* it's gone before you get there.  Nothing breaks immersion like an APC full of bad guys suddenly appearing in front of you!  This is soooo 1995!Want to use roads?  Forget it!  There is a road block literally around almost every corner.  Drive cross-country and forget the roads, you will get there faster!  Seriously!WAY, WAY, too many weapon options!  No one wants to take the time to figure out all that!  By the time you've compared your loot and decided what to keep, sell, and salvage from the last mission your friends have completed 3 arc falls!Stupid weapon designs.  A grenade launcher that shoots a grenade that has to bounce once before detonation?  Absurdly impractical.  What intelligent person would design a weapon like that?  If you want to make "silly weapon game" - then go make "silly weapon game",  I'm sure it would be fun, but make it "silly weapon game"! FOCUS!What's with Pumpkin's in March???  Yes, pumpkin heads and Christmas trees in March - That's just bizarre!  I can only imagine what some desperate developer was thinking to come up with that.  NO!  That does not attract players, it makes the ones you have say "WTF"?No one over 10 likes a bullet sponge boss!!!  Someone innovate, PLEASE!!!!Basically it plays like an early beta release with a developer focus on new mission content rather than fixing core elements of game design that might actually make people want to play it.What I do like;The vehicle system (while it could use improvement).  I enjoy driving and racing the vehicles.  They are fairly responsive and intuitive to control.  (Once you master figuring out where to click to actually get into one)!   What I would like to see  is allowing passengers to fire weapons from the vehicle while it is being driven, and a "hop" or "jump" ability like the tanks have in Mass Effect (Although I know of no president for that in the TV series).Arc falls are good for casual game play.  Jump online, find an arc fall, port there and start shooting stuff, collect loot - pretty mindless.  Die, fail, get called away in the middle and it makes no difference what so ever.

content:
1, 2014
												I don't like MMOs. I have two main reasons for that:1) Mechanics are always pretty much the same, point, click, skill hotkey, etc etc2) Fantasy-Japanese-Medieval-Magic theme over and over again, with silly storyes and sexist characters.Defiance has neither of them. Althought it shares common aspects of any other MMO, this game has a good controller suport, to start with.I know it's not the first MMO shooter, but it delivers pretty well in that aspect, it vaguely reminds me of a MAss Effect X Borderlands feeling.Now, the game has several problems, like being almost constantly laggish, enemyes have questionable AI and interfaces are quite confusing at the start.But somehow this game got me coming back at it.Another good thing is that I find myself useful in every event. In other games, as you join up early and powerless, your useless, but here I find myself on the top 5 players every time.And that´s another great thing, now that it's free. Almost any event or just anywere you're going you'll end up having a lot of other players helping you out (by helping themselves out), and no argument and crying around about sharing the loot.Story here is not great, but is quite engaging. Quests are a little repetitive (go somewhere, shoot enemyes, activate something), but it has kept me hooked.I've never spent real money buying items for the games, but I might give it a try on this one, just to support it.

												Defiance in my opinion is a solid free to play MMO. The game feels like they took the combat stylish gameplay from mass effect added in a borderlands looting system. And then to top it off gave it the overall feel of star wars the old republics MMO feel. The game is much more fun if you play with a friend and keep at the same pace.  To me the game is a little confusing at first. Gameplay / Mission wise if you didnt play from launch. (Because the game is alinned with the TV show defience and is added on with each season. ) it almost feels as if you just dont connect as well with the game.Story wise the game is very weak i probably would understand it more if i watched the show but i just dont want to put the time into the series quiet yet. And another part i felt about the gae that hits the story hard is that almost all the characters voice acting sounds like the producers walked outside found some random hobo and said they would pay for his meal if he did one or two voices.Another thing i must add is character customization is there just minimal.  just dont expect a level of cuztomization like skyrim or SWTOR.BTW the game is much more fun if you play with a friend.So really all in all despite a couple bugs (None game breaking) its a solid MMO/RPG to the genre. And since its free now theres no reason not to check it out. Defiance is a ton of fun and can give you a great time. Thank you!

content:
y 26, 2014
												It's an MMO, but it doesn't feel like one.  That's the biggest thing in a nutshell.  MMOs generally have that vibe about them that says, "Here's a skill bar, pick some powers and use them as needed."  But Defiance doesn't do that.  It's more, "Here's a gun, go kill some stuff."  I love that.  Borderlands of course comes to mind, but it's not really an MMO.  The closest thing I can think of that even got close was Hellgate London[hellgate.t3fun.com], and that game sucked.  But why did it suck?  Why does Defiance not suck?  The difference was that Hellgate gave you guns, sniper rifles, and so on, but accuracy didn't matter.  If you shot the enemy right in the face, it still did it's calculation vs. your accuracy level to see if you made the hit.  That drove me berserk to no end.  Defiance isn't like that AT ALL.  If you have the skill, if you can hit a target, YOU HIT YOUR TARGET.  This single feature above everything else defies anything bad about the game.  It is truly a single player feeling game on a multiplayer environment.  Never once have a shot a bullet and lag caused me to miss.  NEVER.  This is why Defiance is the best shooter MMO that has ever been released, that defies the rules of MMO bringing people who hate the traditional MMO experience back into the fold.  Like me.

I would also hate to see it go away, because unfortunately that is where I see it heading with the empty servers.

content:
er 26, 2013
												Picked this game up for about $4 on sale and I must say, I've definitely got my money's worth from it with about 114 hours worth of gameplay at the time of writing this review.This game plays out very much like an online Borderlands, for better or for worst. The game play is a pretty straight forward with a basic run and gun core gameplay. There are a wide variety of weapon types to choose from, allowing players the ability to customize their character exactly how they like them with no real restrictions as to what weapons can be used by which class or race. There are also a host of abilities that can be used to aid in breaking up the monotony of the run and gun format, much like Borderlands, but often times I have found that they are not essential to game progression. The world is large and feels adequately inhabited, with a number of random missions going on at all corners of the map at any given time. The map itself is gorgeous, with a fair amount of variety from region to region. There are also a number of different gamemodes available to offer a little variety with the world. Everything from time trials on ATV, to special events where you battle progressively more challenging enemies, to multiplayer PVP. And now for the drawbacks. Because the game has the same gameplay mechanics as Borderlands, it can get very monotonous. For the most part, this is counterbalanced by a wide variety of weapons which offer different challenges when fighting enemies, but still the format of running around shooting enemies over and over can get boring. While there are a number of different random missions that crop up all across the map, giving you the opportunity to get additional money, the missions fall into only a few different categories and after a few hours of gameplay, will become less interesting and more of an annoyance due to the lack of variety. Another disappointing aspect is that while the weapon types are varied, the number of available weapons of each type are not so much. There is no real variety to the weapons themselves, unlike Borderlands. In Borderlands, if you found a specific weapon you liked, you could search for additional variants of the same type that offer additional perks or slightly varied stats. In Defiance, once you find a weapon you like, you're pretty much stuck with that same weapon. The only possible choices you have is to find some mods to give it a few additional stat bumps or find the same exact weapon in a more rare version for a few tacked on perks. There's no real variety and aside from personal preference, no obvious reason to choose on weapon over another. Finally, my last gripe is with the PVP... PVP can be a bit glitchy at times. Sometimes when you go to join PVP, its supposed to teleport you to the area where the PVP is going on, but it doesn't, leaving you to commit suicide to fast travel to PVP since often times its a few kilometers away. I've also seen the respawn screen glitch and not allow you to respawn. I waited nearly 10 minutes, with the sounds of the battle continuing in the background. The buttons would respond on mouse over and when clicked, but it would not allow me to respawn. I ended up having to restart the game to clear this fault.Overall, for a pretty fun casual Borderland-esque game, I feel that it is worth the money, especially if you pick it up during a sale, but be warned that a lack of variety can make this game feel a little monotonous, especially on longer play sessions. Also, I hear that the game is a lot more fun if you drag along a few friends... I'd rate this game a solid 4.5 out of 5, since really only a few minor tweaks to the game could definitely improve the overall play value...

content:
2, 2013
												Fantastic fun!Saw this game on sale, which prompted me to watch the show, which hooked me and got me to buy the game for my girlfriend and I, and we have been playing non stop for the week since we got it.First, the separate stories for the show and the game are interesting on their own. Then you add episodic missions with some of the same decent characters from the show and events that explain other events, such as where Nolan gets a particular artifact, and in one mission you technically save the city of Defiance. The game also has a nice long story line mostly independent of the show, fascinating in its own right. The game and show stand on their own no question, but if you follow both they cross over in fantastic ways and further illuminate the world.Controls and combat are solid, what you would expect from a typical 3rd person action shooter, notably with unlimited dodge rolls but without a cover mechanic. The progression is also very nice, with a wide variety of weapons with not much difference between them, instead progressing by skill and based on how you can mod the weapons and how the weapons and mods synergize. There are also 4 core abilities and a plethora of "perks" to unlock, upgrade, and slot. You choose 1 scifi ability and 3+ perks, unlocking slots over time. One of the best features is you can set up different loadouts, with weapon, ability, perk, and even outfit and vehicle choices set per loadout. It is fairly quick to switch loadouts, and you can in combat (pve), though there is no hotkey to switch yet.The game is an mmo and has the necessary elements, clans, chat, friends, etc, but is light on other elements. You can only have a single mission at a time, though they are more engrossing than typical mmo quests by far; it will not cross your mind a second time. The chat is minimalist, but they have announced an overhaul. It is, in a way, a barebones mmo, but a very excellent coop 3rd person action shooter. Yes, there are also some bugs, but none of them terrible now, they are almost always easily ignored.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
0, 2014
												Revised Review 04-12-2015ike any game it has its quirks, but, overall, Defiance, is a PVE co-op player's game.Sure there's PVP, but for we who do not PVP this game has something to do almost all the time.You're ego can go from where you start at 1, to 5900, it gets rough around 4400ish and some of the ways to increase and max, basically your level, are things I won't do, like PVP.  So I'll never max my character, but I find reaching for 5000, and likely 5400 will be satisfactory.Whatever you do find a place called Headlands transit.  Vehicles can be bought there for the game currency, make sure you get at least a duni.  And, when you can affor it, get a Dodge Caravan.  The Duni maneuvers well, you'll be surprised, but the Caravan hits hard, and a most morbid thrill for me is running around killing mutants with my vehicle hahaIf you're into zombies, seek out the afflicted, and make sure you get a BMG weapon.  You'll be laughing over and over every time you use it against afflicted, not the most powerful weapon, but that's relative anyway.Defiance uses a scaling system, those who play Rift will be familiar with this. and the scaling system can make life a pain, but that usually means better rewards.And, as far as metacritic is concerned, I look at it this way.  64 is 14 over 50, and with most game reviewers being PVP elitists, they will never give Defiance a great review, always slightly above average because their PVP bias weighs so heavy in their scoring compared to the game itself.You can't find a better game to play that's free, that has a lot to do, has great clans and great atmosphere, is sci-fi, has aliens and zombies, had a pretty good sized map, has just a lot going for it as a real game, with a storyline that generally follows (a season behind) a syfy television show, with good cut scenes and voice acting.Oh and, no requirement of ground travel to towns, once you find it you double-click and are there.Additionally, and I don't care who thinks this is "unrealistic" no damage from falling, or landing off a cliff, or jumping too high.  The game wants to be played, not cursed, and isn't trying to stop you from enjoying what you want to enjoy.  Not many games anymore do that, most game Devs seem to think their job is destroying anything the players enjoy, while complaining sales are down... Apparently most do not understand the simple principle of cause and effect haha.  Trion has its issues, has had trouble with ups and downs, but they do know how to make a fun game, a challenging game, that once and a while is too much for me, but not so much I curse the game, and the company for being arrogant and not caring about their market and community, because, as I said, overall Trion does deliver what it promises to the player in Defiance.Download and enjoy Defiance, I had my issues with it at one time but they fixed that, and some of them were just me being wrongfully picky hahahaI may soon download the DLC for Defiance, and that says a lot coming from someone who doesn't like to pay to play anything since NCSoft's player abuse by closing Tabula Rasa 2 days before its 2nd Black Friday.-------------------------------------------------------------Old Review begins here:Defiance has its own client and a really great salvage system so you don't lose money you spent previously on upgrades/mods.Easy to play.  Challenging missions and encounters.  Ability to play with all levels together.  Weapons have a great range.  You get a vehicle at the beginning and can upgrade to newer vehicles through faction.  Just all and all well thought out, well planned and appears to be catering to a very broad market, with a game for everyone.A great feature that is missing in many games is being able to set preferences so you don't have to be a PVP player, there's also a shadow conflict area (PVP) that just shows up over cities and areas of the map.  Thus you can participate if you want but are never forced to be a PVP player.  I bring this up as a strictly PVE player who is amazed how large the map is, how they have encounters yet gave us a way around them.  The game seems so designed around the player and the player experience compared to many games I've played, such as Firefall, Face of Mankind, and others which are less well known and/or older.I was really into Tabula Rasa, which was closed due to a lack of advertising that appears to have been coordinated for corporate politics at NCSoft, Defiance is as close as I can come to Tabula Rasa.  There have been others that came close until they made radical changes to their game and chose paths away from as broad a market as they could have (and therefore able to afford the game being open).  Some games, however, are choosing narrow markets which is of course their choice.  Defiance appears to be, since it's based from a SyFy television show, appealing to as broad a market as possible and is designed to do that without these markets segments of gamers with their own designs as to how they'll play the game trespassing on each other.  So I'll say something that my friends will find rare:  Definance is a great game design which, when you play Defiance shows in the graphics, shows in the options that open up as you advance, just a clear demonstration that Trion took the time to really think out the game, while coordinating missions to episodes too.  Definance has a lot of side missions, a lot of content outside of what you can just do to level, and the side missions have their own rewards that you'll want as much as leveling.  I am finding Definance a great game with enough depth to play for a very long time.  I just hope they don't make some radical change in the future away from what will get them the greatest chance to be a great decades played game success.Defiance has their own client too, Glyph, and apparently are no longer going to be played through steam.  You'll note I have no time played showed and this is why -- Been playing for 8 days straight now, it's a lot of fun, a lot to explore still, only partially in San Francisco.Download Defiance, it's free to play, though I believe PVPr's will want to pay some since it appears a bit P2win for that level of game play, but for PVEr's it's just a lot of fun with a great story, in a world where you have no home, no bank, and write your story as you play.McG ("Cutti" in Defiance)P.S.  Just go to this link, http://www.trionworlds.com/defiance/en/2014/07/28/introducing-silicon-valleys-encrypted-items/ and do a word search for "punative," then read the paragraph around it and you see developers refering to themselves as gamers and explaining not to do something because it would be received as punative to the player community.  This is what we gamers are looking for, we who so many companies just want to take our money and ignore what we want or the fact they presented a game and its gameplay asking for players and we accepted their offer, only to have them treat it all as erasable at the developer's whim without any thought to the punitive nature of what they were doing to the player experience enjoyed, even afer losing half their player base.  Integrity is a rare quality, and though Trion has issues with games they make and support response times, their developers, the heart of their game's designs, aren't egocentric and ignoring the very players they hope will buy things in their in game shops.  This is a rare quality in a gaming company and one that you begin the appreciation of by downloading the game.

												This game is a BLAST! After going through an easy tutorial you are open to roam a large open-world on a vehicle you can spawn out of thin air, then come across random multiplayer events, like going through waves of enemies protecting an 'Ark', with other people (very epic). I especially LOVE the combat and gameplay, it is SOOO satisfying, for example:  Snipe a dude, throw a grenade, blow up an explosive barrel with enimies around it, then pull out a machine gun and go crazy while rolling inbetween corridors. Also the enviroments are AMAZING! like the Golden Gate bridge all broken and old, and i like the fact that what you see... YOU CAN EXPLORE! The graphics and story are also amazing for a F2P game and not to mention the game is completely FREE, and in my opinion it is Not Pay-to-Win either, YES you can by the coins that let you buy ingame items, but you can get the coins yourself and buy and sell using IN-game currency. Did not pay a Cent of real money. The ONLY downside is the servers are down alot and occasionally the server lags, but... WHO CARES? I Love this game, i made this review when i have played only 4 hours of the game and it is already my top 10 games list..... just try it out! *also, the TV show is complete and utter CRAP*

content:
y 1, 2015
												Major things about Defiance: It is a free to play game and Third Person ShooterLet me get this out in the beginning of this review: Defiance is amazing+Free 2 Play! Wide variety of weapon choices, intruiging bosses, and its a show also! The money system (scrip) isn't that hard to get, and there is a good trade system between players and stores. The 5 different rarity levels go like this: White=Common, Green=Uncommon, Blue=Rare, Purple=Epic, and Orange is legendary! And if you want to edit your gun, you can! With Defiance's Salvage Matrix, you can change your weapon in a variety of ways: If the weapon has an EGO level above or below your's by 100, you can use ArkForge to level up/down any item. You can also change your gun's mods, which consist of barrel mods (ex. Power Bore ll), Magazine Mods (ex. Radiation Converter IV), Sight Mods (ex. Telescopic Sight V), and Stock Mods (ex. Close Quarters Stock I). All of these mods also have rarity levels (white, green, blue, purple, orange). Sometimes, guns don't come with all the mod slots. In order to fix this, you must have to click "Add Mods" on the Ark Salvage screen. But beware, not all mods are for the same weapons. Defiance also has a PvP system, but it can sometimes be hectic. There are Shadow Wars and Competitve Maps. The reason I personally don't do PvP is because (a) The people are VERY good and (b) The weapons and abilities can be over powered. With that out of the way, let me talk to you about the feel of the shooting. I can't really tell you the word to describe Defiance's shooting system.................aha, it's perfect! Yeah, in my opinion, The shooting in this game is great. (ex. I am using a semi-automatic sniper rifle and I shoot. I can see the bullet trail leading to were I just was. ex. I mod my current Light-Machine gun with a Inciendary Magazine; the bullet's come out red and sometimes will light enemies on fire. And if you don't care about PvP, Defiance has a very fun Multiplayer. All in all, the only thing I really don't care for in Defiance, is the slightly bad PvP and (unfortunately) not the best graphics. What I mean by this, is that when you zoom in on a other players with a scope, you will see a blurry mess. I would recommend Defiance to anyone who likes video games.

er 27, 2013
												A pretty interesting MMO, has a kind of Borderlands feel to it. Defiance is basicly an open world shooter based on a tv series.The game has an unique way of playing co-op where anyone at any time can join your quests and help you. The leveling in this game is also pretty unique where you don't actually have a level but you gain XP to spend on skill points. Gear does not have a level requierment so a low level could easily match up against a high level in PvP.The graphics are not the best out there right now but do have it's own feel to them.The vehicles in the game have a pretty good feeling to them, the sound of the vehicles could be redone though.Not a lot of character customization or armors in this game and the cool cosmetic items cost real world money.The game has a lot of areas and envoirments to explore and a lot of fun quests to do alone or with friends.I can recommend this game mainly because it gives a lot of fun for small coin, and with no actual subscription as in you pay once and you can play forever makes this game a good purchase.

content:
ry 26, 2015
												Ill do a quick pros and cons and then just write my opinion about it.Pros:-Its probably the best MMO SHOOTER out there right now.-You dont need to pay any money to be "good" at the game.-The english voice acting is pretty neat-The story is fairly interesting and well designed-The open world gives you a great travel system. Quicktravel to friends, quicktravel to cities and drive a car, which levels with you.-Multiple weapon levels, aswell as each weapon being masterable, giving an additional statbonus-it reminds me alot of Mass Effect and Borderlands, both being very good games-Time limited open world events. Arcfalls, Incursions, everything to gain levels and items quickly and while having fun-Co-op missions with a cool story-When you join a group or one of the previously named your level gets raised to a specific point so all members deal the same amount of damage-Buying a dlc doesnt make you incredible op. It just enables you to use more, slightly stronger weapons aswell as names, cars and other stuff.Something between pro and con:-The game is not always easy to figure out, making it sorta harder for newbies. Then again, there are alot of games like that, e.g. Dark Souls, which is equally non-explaining and loved for it. For me the game was pretty okay to figure out, some things though are still a bit in the black.-The car handling. Mostly a pain in the bum-bum (cause no swearing on steam..) , sometimes good to handle.-Some weapons are dlc exclusive. You can still get them and sell them, you just cant use them-Enemies are extremely twitchy. They dodgeroll when you shoot, they strafe while shooting and they randomly switch targets. I dont know if its supposed to be THAT hard to shoot someone or if they just aggro randomly.Con:-Some missions are repetetitve, having you ambushed alot.-Some missions are very short. You can finish them in 30 seconds because its just "Pick this up and done"-Small open world events are fairly annoying-The german (and I guess every other but english) voice-over. Horrible stuff.Server lag and bugs:-(bugs)Its pretty common to have lag, but I guess this is why the game got rated so badly. Sometimes you drop out of the server, losing progress in the raid you do at the moment. Otherwise its fairly forgiving. In an hour it happens ~3 times max. Its not that big of a deal, its mostly when you are in the inventory and it doesnt load.-(server lag)Some days the server is pretty filled, making you headshot someone that falls down about 3 seconds later. Sure, its annoying, but its very rarely like that. Most of the time its pretty responsive.My friend and I played it for free for quite a while (about 10 hours), being hooked by the gameplay. He played alot of MMOs back then and Im a fan of shooters, making it a good game to play together. So we decided to support the developers, buying two seasons passes. Thas 60 bucks, about as much as any EA game.

												If you are not the usual mmorpg guy or if you are bored of them or if you want something new try out "Defiance". It  is so different to all other mmorpg's. It is a third person shooter, you fight with guns only. You need to get in dungeons sometimes or your quests are events in wich everyone can participate and there are big events appearing on the map where many players take part of. The events difficulty is always adapted to the number of players, so you could do them alone. 												Love this game, almost all the players are great. you can follow the storyline or you can go play with other players or you can play with other players going through the storyline. there is so much space on the server that it can easily uphold the stress all the players put on it. there are also various challenges and minigames that you can do. there are several ways to earn the money that you use and you can trade items with other players. there are only a few confusing  things in the game, but the players will help you and sometimes, literally, walk you through the parts you are having difficulty with. content:
y 26, 2015
												TLDR: This game is basically a more serious, online version of borderlands, and that's not necessarily a bad thing. Its free so it's definitely worth the time to download and have a play around.The main problem i have with the game could be summed up by a description of one fight. I was doing a story mission, running around a ranch shooting raiders. so far so good. I then saw a miniboss on a nearby rooftop, so i pull out my sniper rifle, and shoot him in the head. his health bar stays the same but the damage readout says 4000 damage. i empty the rest of the clip into his head. not only is he still standing, his health bar is almost full. So, skip to the sixtieth headshot i get on him, and i've run out of ammo. i pull out a light machine gun and close in. five hundred rounds later, he's at 60% health. i'm not quite out of ammo but he has been spamming grenades all around me and now there's nowhere for me to go that doesn't have a detonating grenade. i get one-shot and go into bleedout. i revive myself and run behind a building.i see an ammo crate, refill my ammo, and ~150 headshots later he dies.So my problem is that enemies are far too bulletsponge-y. A basic, unarmoured bandit, with no helmet, will often take two, three or four headshots from a sniper rifle, or dozens of point blank headshots from an assault rifle, SMG, LMG etc.This, combined with the fact that enemies will just keep spawning faster than you can fill them with bullets means tht the gunplay is a bit of a letdown. quite a big problem, as a lot of mission objectives involve 'interact with this object for five seconds without taking damage' objetcives, meaning you either cheese it with cloak, or you spend 5-10 minutes in the same area just mindlessly killing the same enemies over and over again until you've got a five second window. Fast-spawning mobs would be fine, if they died quickly. bulletsponges would be fine if they were finite, which wouldn't really work in an MMO. sadly, this means that you can snipe everyone in an area, walk up to the objective and find that there was really no point because the enemies have respawned already and you're stuck in the same close quarters battle anyway.Aside from that, it is a good game. the fact it was originally not free to play means that the microtransactions aren't built in from the ground up to be 'necessary', vehicles are actually vehicles, not mounts, and you can do some fun stuff with the jet-booster quadbike you get half an hour into the game

												This game was around here for a season or so, and now it became free-to-play. To be honest, I never really seem to care about Defiance while it was in stores with that heavyweight price-tag. Nothing special, as I was thinking.Yesterday I downloaded it just to see what it's all about, and here -bam! - strike! This is one of the most exciting action-filled MMORPGs out there, because it does taste like a sweet mix of Borderlands and Halo, combined with MMO-mechanics and a freakin' HUGE open-world. The setting looks a bit weird, like if Mad Max would meet Johnny Mnemonic along with Claptrap and Master Chief.Played it 4 four hours straight without a break - haven't been into a game this much for a long time. Highly recommended to all MMO and action lovers out there. Especially if you enjoyed the life on Pandora.

content:
er 7, 2014
												Installed this yesterday evening and have clocked up 9.5hrs.~When you first start it seems a bit low-budget and a bit like a B movie, I wasn't so sure at first, it just seemed a bit thrown together, but, if you stick it out until you've done the first few main story quests and stumble upon some public geared events you may well start to enjoy it. There's plenty of players online that you bump into, random side quests and lots of public events you encounter when just travelling to and from your objective. In that respect it's been a fun few hours.If I had to describe the game it's Mass Effect meets Destiny meets fallout with some RIFT style random events you get caught up in. Playstyle is very much like mass effect, it's third person offset camera, with basic run and roll / dodge but lacking the cover system. The way you run around dispatching enemies in various environments and zones reminds me of playing mass effect vs destiny, the hud animations when you collect items and interact are similar too.There are quite a few similarities to Destiny whilst on that note. So if you are looking for a sci-fi fix of that type then take a look at this. I think Bungy had quite a bit of inspiration from this. I played Destiny from beta and release, leveled up a Hunter to 30 with all legendary and exotics, did all instances / strikes and put in a hell of a lot of playtime (then got bored and sold it along with the PS4) so I have seen all of it.The environments the art style and post-apocolyptic battle of Defiance much like the (rather poorly explained) battle of the traveller and environments. Certain mobs look very much like the Knights and others (and raiders look nearly identical to some of the enemies on earth, mutants with swords charging at you very similar in idea to the vandals concept).Scenery is of a very similar style, certain outfits and gear look similar, the HP system and hail-of-bullet style play and mob encounters are similar too. Even down to the rocket / thrust system on mounts and the way mounts are summoned and an AI 'ghost' style entity guiding you. I have the cloak ability and building on other specs similar to the hunter style play. There are certain things it does better too, like the fact that it IS open world, and not just some crappy restricted zone or 'patrol' style small planet map. The actual social aspect that was heavily lacking in destiny is in Defiance. I could actually see me getting more play time from this.I'm not sure of the longevity of this game at the moment, there is a very big map and several continents to explore, I have travelled to quite a few zones already but I am still discovering places, I feel the combat may get a little tiring, but there are plenty of weapons and a lot of modifications that you can do to them (you can modify the stock, barrel, scope and ammo / magazine type).There are a ton of micro-transactions, the store has a lot of gear you can purchase, but they have to make some money somehow since it's gone F2P right? The servers won't run themselves! I haven't found yet however that I need to buy anything, quests do the standard MMO thing and reward gear, be it weapons, outfits or shields / mods, so there is plenty to keep you going while you assess whether you really do like the game or not. And if you like it, why not buy a weapon or outfit, it's cheaper than a pint of beer...Some good and bad points so far:+ Graphics are very pleasent - nice effects, nice level of detail and terrain looks very good, models look good too+ Well designed environments+ High FPS - even on highest settings performance seems very good, never dropped bellow 60fps once, even with about 100 players on the screen in a total frag-fest+ LOTS of action - if you like unleashing a hail of bullets and projectiles into enemies you will enjoy it+ Lots of gear - Weapons, modifications and equipment available even without buying from the store+ Zero server and connection lag experienced thus far+ Good sound FX+ Open world - no real set path, do anything you want and at your own pace+ No leveling system - as such, this is a postive I believe, new players can instantly join in with veterans and have fun+ Skill trees with lots of progression+ If your into the series, this links in nicely and has episodic content that carries over to the game+ Fast travel if you want to get somewhere in a hurry- Widescreen users may experience 'vanishing' textures and objects on high settings - after some play time (memory leak?) although the game still looks great on medium and this problem will go away- Story is a bit bland - not very well explained, not engrosing or that interesting in game- Music - gets very annoying after a while, the combat music is limited to one track that really gets on your nerves, at least you can turn it off- Some enemies have way too much hp - and not in a good way, IE in certain quests the mob won't kill you, you won't be worried at all but you will roll around shooting him for about 10 mins getting very bored with his never ending HP!Overall if you have a few spare minutes, are bored and fancy just trying something new, then for free it is really worth a shot.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
er 27, 2013
												A pretty interesting MMO, has a kind of Borderlands feel to it. Defiance is basicly an open world shooter based on a tv series.The game has an unique way of playing co-op where anyone at any time can join your quests and help you. The leveling in this game is also pretty unique where you don't actually have a level but you gain XP to spend on skill points. Gear does not have a level requierment so a low level could easily match up against a high level in PvP.The graphics are not the best out there right now but do have it's own feel to them.The vehicles in the game have a pretty good feeling to them, the sound of the vehicles could be redone though.Not a lot of character customization or armors in this game and the cool cosmetic items cost real world money.The game has a lot of areas and envoirments to explore and a lot of fun quests to do alone or with friends.I can recommend this game mainly because it gives a lot of fun for small coin, and with no actual subscription as in you pay once and you can play forever makes this game a good purchase.

The leveling in this game is also pretty unique where you don't actually have a level but you gain XP to spend on skill points. Gear does not have a level requierment so a low level could easily match up against a high level in PvP.The graphics are not the best out there right now but do have it's own feel to them.The vehicles in the game have a pretty good feeling to them, the sound of the vehicles could be redone though.Not a lot of character customization or armors in this game and the cool cosmetic items cost real world money.The game has a lot of areas and envoirments to explore and a lot of fun quests to do alone or with friends.I can recommend this game mainly because it gives a lot of fun for small coin, and with no actual subscription as in you pay once and you can play forever makes this game a good purchase.

content:
1, 2013
												Solid, Fun MMO shooter that mechanically is similar to Borderlands. It is doing something that's never been done before, tying into a TV show on SyFy and events from the game influence the TV show and vice versa. The game has had it's fair share of hiccups, but Trion has done a good job with constant patches. A Huge DLC pack is set to come out late July. Game plays best if you join up with some friends. After 200 hours, I can say, Defiance is really, really fun. It's the first MMO I've been able to get into.8.8 out of 10.Use my referral link if registering an account (and/or buying the game):http://www.defiance.com/en/welcome-to-defiance/?rc=XYDRD3FWKK6722MDPZTK

												This game has few MAJOR problems because dev's wanted as many players/platforms into the game, but theres also alot of stuff i like in a game. Thats why i am still playing this. There has always been problems with different computers not performing as the best. So that is why this game needs serious fixing.I recommend this because i like the consept of DEFIANCE, some pvp elements are quite fun, voice acting is good, story line is exquisite and someone has to get those arkfalls.Pros.1. Alot of players.2. Very enjoyable gameplay. (exept sniper)3. Dynamic events.4. Challenges,contracts,missions everything i love in a game.5. GUNS, LOTS AND LOTS of guns, one for every mind.6. Loot system is quite good. (There is an in-game market, where you can buy lockboxes that contain weapons and other misc. items)Cons.1. Draw distance is horrible for pc players or anyone who enjoys sniping at long distances, you get invisible enemies after 100-150 meters. (PS3 and xbox360) Pc players could always look at the options and choose options that suits their systems.2.  Not that much graphical options...3.  Gameplay gets repetetive after 13-16 hours.4. Market. This just sucks. You can actually buy lockboxes from there, those contain weapons and other misc. items. Sometimes this game feels like Pay to Win...5. If there is too many enemies in one area you will only see the enemies and not the players... Makes it kinda hard for medics. For example one event there was about 40-60 players and suddenly there was only me against 40-50 enemies that suddenly lose health and die.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
ber 17, 2013
												Seriously, this is one of the best M M O games out there in my opinion. Its a great combination RPG and third-person shooter, with a very well balanced mix of open world cooperative and pvp gameplay. There are plenty of missions broken up into different categories. Main story missions, side missions, some repeatable, some not. As well as both coop and pvp missions. So no matter if your a lone player, or playing with friends, there is enough in Defiance to keep everyone happy. Oh, and we can't forget Arkfalls, huge cooperative battles between a boss and the players in the open world. The gameplay and game mechanics are best compared to Borderlands. Weapon and item nano (elemental) effects, weapon customization, lock boxes similar to the loot crates in Borderlands, and fully customizable skill (Ego) tree.  Lots of different vehicles to drive, weapons to own, different outfits and titles to wear, there is plenty of customization available for most anyone.  .

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2013
												Defiance is an interesting game world, in parallel with it's TV-series Defiance. Defiance is a decent 3rd person shooter game, with a deep and interesting story-line. In combination with the TV-series, it makes the game even more interesting. Special dynamic events that keeps you interested, even after finishing the main story-line. And with special missions that are linked with TV-episodes. However Defiance is pretty pricey for what the game represents, and technically does not introduce anything new in the MMO world.  But the leveling system is something unique and matches very well on how you advance in the game. And it leans on the mechanics that sometimes it is more interesting to play this game with a friend.

												Defiance is an unique game.Its a very innovative MMORPG i like refreshing peaces of work like this.It combines some of the best things of some other games.It has an open world where you can do pretty much anything.It has a Co-op that is very good.It has a well thought PvP system and nice PvP events in the Open world area.It has tons of different weapons and on top of that any weapon can have a different kind of ammo and effect(nanoeffect).Which makes the game weapon wise very divers.The graphics are actually pretty good and the game does not lag that much for a game with good graphycs.The only downside of it is that the environment is too still...everywhere you go you switch between two different styles of backgrounds barren lands and alien plant green life.NOT MUCH DIVERSITY IN THAT ARE.Which can lead to Boredom. content:
ber 12, 2016
												I started a bit ago and been having a blast.   Mostly i have been working on raising my weapon skills and learning the game bit by bit.  I usually do a bunch of events and mini events and slowly been moving across the map.  Flying through the quests would make you to weak and not nearly as much enjoyable since you would miss so much fun content and unique environments. Joining a large clan has been helpful for events as you can telport to any clan player instantly. The only money i have spent is to purchase two inventory upgrades to get 30 more slots.  Which got easier when i figure out i could store mods on purchased weapons that already have all the slots unlocked, so 1 slot could technically hold 5 items (1 weapon and 4 mods)   I kept a list of weapons I liked for awhile until i got good at recognizing the types that i prefer for each.  Now i just have a spread sheet that lists the mods that are stored so i can get the ones i want easily. I have around 1500 ego now and all my weapon skills are at 10+,  I dont really feel like I'm missing anything yet by not having any of the dlc's.   Some weapons can only be used if you have teh dlc but there are so many others dropping that you can use, I just break them down.  Speaking of the large events they are a blast, you start in one area of the map and do bunches of small events all across a large area until you get to the main event then it's a battle royal of death and destruction.   Don't let the skill system get you to bothered i had over 55 points saved before i even spent on any of the small skills other than decoy.  I finally spent those and in a few days ago and got all the main skills i wanted,  and now i'm already back up to 40+ points so i'll start buying some others to try custom setups. The best starter items i would go for is Decoy as your main skill.Cellular ArmorDetachmentSelf MedicatedRegenerationTime OutPumped UpExcecutionExcape ArtistFailsafeMax all them out and youll have a solid build of skills then you can spend the others however you want to play around.  You can only have 9 skills active at a time so no worries. The more playing around casually you do the more fun you will have with this game, Flying through all the quests to get as far as possible makes you miss out on most the immersiveness.

content:
y 22, 2015
												Highly recommend! With over 800 hours in I finally decided to write this review. It's a 3rd person over the shoulder shooter with a huge variety of weapons and every weapon has 4 mod slots, even beginners can start modding almost right away. You can easily mod very cheaply or use high end mods that are available thru vendors bought with earned scrip or from drops and lock boxes. This game is free to play yet not pay to win. Anyone can get legendary guns without paying a dime. There are a number of items you can buy with real money but they are appearance and convenience like extra inventory space or key slots but again you do not need to buy them to play through to max level and see and enjoy all content and dominate in the instances. The graphics while not great are quite good and very detailed and the player models look great but movement is not as fluid as it could be but you will hardly notice because you will be having too much fun shooting and shooting and shooting so much content it gets insane! The weapons are a joy to use and modify, their mechanics and sounds are mind blowing, the explosions are huge and the enemies are everywhere from easy to extremely hard.This game has the least amount of chat drama I have ever seen and very few trolls, the players are mostly helpful and joining a clan makes it even better. PVE and PVP, your choice when you want and as much as you want. It's free! Give it a go!

content:
17
												I play this because friends play this.  Period.As an RPG it has little in common with the TV series other than some names, races, and a couple of characters.  As an RPG it pretty much totally lacks immersion.In terms of design flaws;The GUI is poorly designed and needs an overhaul.There are WAY too many forms of currency. In-game communication with other party members and/or players is horrid.   The game even periodically breaks your team/group without notice.  Occasionally, you get sent to a server other than your friends/team/group, without notice.  So even though you are technically at the same event or mission, you can't see or help each other because you are in reality - on a different server.  I traded with another player once, I still couldn't tell you how we did it (The GUI is THAT bad). Server connections are gawd-awful!  Frequently at well attended arc falls/events, all the players and/or mobs will completely disappear.  It doesn't matter if other players can revive you if you get KO'd, because they can't see you and don't know that you are down.  You can't get a decent group score or loot, because you can't see the mobs to shoot at them.Mission/quest tracking is terrible.  NPC dialogue is looped which not only breaks immersion, but gets really annoying after the first 2-3 loops of the same dialogue.  Scotty frequently beams mobs in and out of your location from deep space!!!  Yes! You are standing there and all of a sudden *POOF* you are in the middle of the enemy camp!  Heading for that ammo chest to re-stock on ammo?  *POOF* it's gone before you get there.  Nothing breaks immersion like an APC full of bad guys suddenly appearing in front of you!  This is soooo 1995!Want to use roads?  Forget it!  There is a road block literally around almost every corner.  Drive cross-country and forget the roads, you will get there faster!  Seriously!WAY, WAY, too many weapon options!  No one wants to take the time to figure out all that!  By the time you've compared your loot and decided what to keep, sell, and salvage from the last mission your friends have completed 3 arc falls!Stupid weapon designs.  A grenade launcher that shoots a grenade that has to bounce once before detonation?  Absurdly impractical.  What intelligent person would design a weapon like that?  If you want to make "silly weapon game" - then go make "silly weapon game",  I'm sure it would be fun, but make it "silly weapon game"! FOCUS!What's with Pumpkin's in March???  Yes, pumpkin heads and Christmas trees in March - That's just bizarre!  I can only imagine what some desperate developer was thinking to come up with that.  NO!  That does not attract players, it makes the ones you have say "WTF"?No one over 10 likes a bullet sponge boss!!!  Someone innovate, PLEASE!!!!Basically it plays like an early beta release with a developer focus on new mission content rather than fixing core elements of game design that might actually make people want to play it.What I do like;The vehicle system (while it could use improvement).  I enjoy driving and racing the vehicles.  They are fairly responsive and intuitive to control.  (Once you master figuring out where to click to actually get into one)!   What I would like to see  is allowing passengers to fire weapons from the vehicle while it is being driven, and a "hop" or "jump" ability like the tanks have in Mass Effect (Although I know of no president for that in the TV series).Arc falls are good for casual game play.  Jump online, find an arc fall, port there and start shooting stuff, collect loot - pretty mindless.  Die, fail, get called away in the middle and it makes no difference what so ever.

content:
er 26, 2013
												Picked this game up for about $4 on sale and I must say, I've definitely got my money's worth from it with about 114 hours worth of gameplay at the time of writing this review.This game plays out very much like an online Borderlands, for better or for worst. The game play is a pretty straight forward with a basic run and gun core gameplay. There are a wide variety of weapon types to choose from, allowing players the ability to customize their character exactly how they like them with no real restrictions as to what weapons can be used by which class or race. There are also a host of abilities that can be used to aid in breaking up the monotony of the run and gun format, much like Borderlands, but often times I have found that they are not essential to game progression. The world is large and feels adequately inhabited, with a number of random missions going on at all corners of the map at any given time. The map itself is gorgeous, with a fair amount of variety from region to region. There are also a number of different gamemodes available to offer a little variety with the world. Everything from time trials on ATV, to special events where you battle progressively more challenging enemies, to multiplayer PVP. And now for the drawbacks. Because the game has the same gameplay mechanics as Borderlands, it can get very monotonous. For the most part, this is counterbalanced by a wide variety of weapons which offer different challenges when fighting enemies, but still the format of running around shooting enemies over and over can get boring. While there are a number of different random missions that crop up all across the map, giving you the opportunity to get additional money, the missions fall into only a few different categories and after a few hours of gameplay, will become less interesting and more of an annoyance due to the lack of variety. Another disappointing aspect is that while the weapon types are varied, the number of available weapons of each type are not so much. There is no real variety to the weapons themselves, unlike Borderlands. In Borderlands, if you found a specific weapon you liked, you could search for additional variants of the same type that offer additional perks or slightly varied stats. In Defiance, once you find a weapon you like, you're pretty much stuck with that same weapon. The only possible choices you have is to find some mods to give it a few additional stat bumps or find the same exact weapon in a more rare version for a few tacked on perks. There's no real variety and aside from personal preference, no obvious reason to choose on weapon over another. Finally, my last gripe is with the PVP... PVP can be a bit glitchy at times. Sometimes when you go to join PVP, its supposed to teleport you to the area where the PVP is going on, but it doesn't, leaving you to commit suicide to fast travel to PVP since often times its a few kilometers away. I've also seen the respawn screen glitch and not allow you to respawn. I waited nearly 10 minutes, with the sounds of the battle continuing in the background. The buttons would respond on mouse over and when clicked, but it would not allow me to respawn. I ended up having to restart the game to clear this fault.Overall, for a pretty fun casual Borderland-esque game, I feel that it is worth the money, especially if you pick it up during a sale, but be warned that a lack of variety can make this game feel a little monotonous, especially on longer play sessions. Also, I hear that the game is a lot more fun if you drag along a few friends... I'd rate this game a solid 4.5 out of 5, since really only a few minor tweaks to the game could definitely improve the overall play value...

content:
ry 27
												I love this game but it is difficult to recommend. Here's my longest review ever. First, a description. Defiance is an MMO with a strong single-player plot to get you through quite a few hours. The story is interesting enough and the voice acting is great! This plot acts as an extended introduction to the game world. After that, you will need to find various public happenings (seiges, arkfalls, etc.) in which to help and compete with other players. There are also instances that spawn self-contained worlds. Some of these are PvP, others are cooperative. You also have daily and weekly missions to fulfill. All in all, similar to other MMOs. You get a cool game world and then comes the endless grind. The game is very much a glass half-full thing. First, I love the look, which is post-apocalyptic without being too dark and beige. Enemies are varied and interesting. But over the long haul you get used to them. No further mobs have been introduced. (Not strictly the case, but they are variations on the tried and true.)Your own character is rendered nicely and you can dress up in different outfits, if that's your thing. Though this consists only of changing two articles of clothing. You start the game by choosing one of four classes and one of four main EGO powers, which becomes your special ability. Over time you fill out other passives, actives, and gain all four EGO powers. Then you are just the same as everyone else. Yep, everyone has the same attributes! The classes don't matter either, and races are purely cosmetic... and look similar enough. As do (most) of the costumes. You can spend real cash on stuff that is just a different colour from what you already have. Ho hum.The gunplay is very good. In fact, though I haven't played them all, combat in Defiance is the best of all MMOs. Though it is third-person, it has the feeling of a FPS, which I love. You can get and modify different guns as you go on, though to a large extent there is not much difference between these either. Until you get to end-game, when you can no longer level (increase EGO), the most important thing is the EGO of your gun. Even 100 EGO matters and that's over a scale of 6000. The game is free to play, though you will need to spend money. First, buy all the DLC by way of the Season's Pass. Really, once you discover you actually do want to play, just buy this, or you will be restricted in several annoying ways. Besides, then you get to use swords! (Not an optimal strategy and kind of orphaned, but fun anyway.) Second, you will need more inventory slots, a lot more. Third, you will need more key capacity, or you will not be able to unlock the better random gear boxes. Overall, however, you won't need to spend too much.Several things in Defiance completely suck, the main one being that the number of sucky things has been steadily increasing. So what was a decent and fun game when I started is being squeezed out of existence by Trion. To the point that I will NEVER buy another one of their games. OK, let me list the sucky things.As mentioned, classes and races DO NOT MATTER. This is not an RPG at all. Which is a wasted opportunity. Swords don't matter, they are just fun for a while. Vehicles don't really matter, since they are almost all the same. A lot of guns, likewise. Certain in-game currencies that you can get free by playing are practically useless -- you will soon have millions of clams you cannot use on anything. However, the one useful currency, used to upgrade guns (arkforge) has become rare as hen's teeth, almost impossible to grind, so you need to buy it with cash money. At insanely exhorbitant rates. Or not get cool upgraded guns.A new fun and highly challenging end-game mode called Expeditions was recently added. But to play you need to spend a brand new currency that you get only in trickles and cannot earn. So you must buy these Hunter Requisitions with cash money. Or not play. It seems that Trion is now gradually introducing features people have asked for for years, like private instances. But you must spend HR to play these! PvP sucks and is highly biased towards the higher tier players. But it is a REQUIREMENT to play PvP to build your character to the maximum cap. Some of the other necessary achievements are worse than grinding, since they rely on luck repeated over and over. Or stupid actions no-one would ever want to do. Duels. Turret kills. Driving a big truck. Say no more. Doing well in an event and getting high on the leaderboard gets you nothing. Loot is not tied to doing well. Someone might spend 15 minutes grinding and get crap, while someone else who camps and shoots a mob ONCE will get a legendary. I have no idea who thought that was a good idea, but it is an integral part of the game. Really, Defiance is one big gamble and does not reward intelligence or skill.And now we have a new rarity (Supreme) that guns can be upgraded to.... by gambling on success, paying arkforge, bought with real money. Unbelievable.Defiance could have been so much more. It could have been Godlike!! But stupid punitive decisions on the part of Trion have ruined it. Nonetheless, it's still the MMO with the best combat system, so I play it. It's a shame that someone else can't take the exact same engine and build a good game on it

												Before everyone/anyone decides to say, I am warning you right now: If you don't like this game for certain reasons, then thats fine by me. However, for those of you who constantly bash this game after not even plying it or giving it a fair chance, I'll say this right now: QUIT YOUR WHINING AND DEAL WITH IT! THIS GAME WAS MADE THE WAY THEY INTENDED TO. NOW SHUT UP ALREADY! Now, down to the review. Defiance is honestly in my opinion one of the more interesting mmo type games out there. To me, it offers more than what you want to expect out of it, which in my case, is a really good thing since it adds more playability to the game. I would go into the details of how good this game is to me, but honestly, if you really want to know, play it yourself and find out. Also, one last thing before I end this review. I want everyone who plays this game to know and give me your suggestions about this game versus Destiny. When I mean suggestions, I mean the pros and cons that these games have other each other in terms of good or bad. Besides that though, if you do decide to comment on that subject, then feel free to go ahead and do so. Also, if you do comment, don't just sit there and say that this game is better just because it is.

content:
y 26, 2015
												TLDR: This game is basically a more serious, online version of borderlands, and that's not necessarily a bad thing. Its free so it's definitely worth the time to download and have a play around.The main problem i have with the game could be summed up by a description of one fight. I was doing a story mission, running around a ranch shooting raiders. so far so good. I then saw a miniboss on a nearby rooftop, so i pull out my sniper rifle, and shoot him in the head. his health bar stays the same but the damage readout says 4000 damage. i empty the rest of the clip into his head. not only is he still standing, his health bar is almost full. So, skip to the sixtieth headshot i get on him, and i've run out of ammo. i pull out a light machine gun and close in. five hundred rounds later, he's at 60% health. i'm not quite out of ammo but he has been spamming grenades all around me and now there's nowhere for me to go that doesn't have a detonating grenade. i get one-shot and go into bleedout. i revive myself and run behind a building.i see an ammo crate, refill my ammo, and ~150 headshots later he dies.So my problem is that enemies are far too bulletsponge-y. A basic, unarmoured bandit, with no helmet, will often take two, three or four headshots from a sniper rifle, or dozens of point blank headshots from an assault rifle, SMG, LMG etc.This, combined with the fact that enemies will just keep spawning faster than you can fill them with bullets means tht the gunplay is a bit of a letdown. quite a big problem, as a lot of mission objectives involve 'interact with this object for five seconds without taking damage' objetcives, meaning you either cheese it with cloak, or you spend 5-10 minutes in the same area just mindlessly killing the same enemies over and over again until you've got a five second window. Fast-spawning mobs would be fine, if they died quickly. bulletsponges would be fine if they were finite, which wouldn't really work in an MMO. sadly, this means that you can snipe everyone in an area, walk up to the objective and find that there was really no point because the enemies have respawned already and you're stuck in the same close quarters battle anyway.Aside from that, it is a good game. the fact it was originally not free to play means that the microtransactions aren't built in from the ground up to be 'necessary', vehicles are actually vehicles, not mounts, and you can do some fun stuff with the jet-booster quadbike you get half an hour into the game

												Before everyone/anyone decides to say, I am warning you right now: If you don't like this game for certain reasons, then thats fine by me. However, for those of you who constantly bash this game after not even plying it or giving it a fair chance, I'll say this right now: QUIT YOUR WHINING AND DEAL WITH IT! THIS GAME WAS MADE THE WAY THEY INTENDED TO. NOW SHUT UP ALREADY! Now, down to the review. Defiance is honestly in my opinion one of the more interesting mmo type games out there. To me, it offers more than what you want to expect out of it, which in my case, is a really good thing since it adds more playability to the game. I would go into the details of how good this game is to me, but honestly, if you really want to know, play it yourself and find out. Also, one last thing before I end this review. I want everyone who plays this game to know and give me your suggestions about this game versus Destiny. When I mean suggestions, I mean the pros and cons that these games have other each other in terms of good or bad. Besides that though, if you do decide to comment on that subject, then feel free to go ahead and do so. I'm mainly asking because I think Destiny does have a     lot of problems and good things to it like Defiance. Also, if you do comment, don't just sit there and say that this game is better just because it is.

VERY nice F2P, MMO, open-world shooter.   Join forces with others on the server to dispatch mutants and other foes and save your allies in a surrealistic, post-apocalyptic environment.  Lots of features and upgrades, including ability to spawn an all-terrain 'sport-bike' (and later, a 4WD vehicle) whenever you need one.  Good variety of terrain, structures, and targets.  Weapons are quite decent, too.  Well-deserving of a Level 5 badge, if nothing else...Check it out.  Five-finger discounted...☺

content:
y 15, 2016
												This game is a prime example of how NOT to make a free to play game.  Absolutely everything that you ever hated about every other cheap console title is present here. My list of complaints could go on for days on end, but lets try to narrow it down to what made me review it negatively shall we?  Pay To Win... Need I say more. Sure you can unlock things for free, but everything from (the few armors that look good) to weapons people obviously spent money maxing out the rarity is only going to be obtainable through your wallet book. The most despicable thing about that concept is that it effects PvE AND PvP heavily. People who cranked out the dough early on will have a significant edge over people who haven't spent a dime. You'll next to NEVER kill someone who's either spent money making their weapon gold or farming for like 90 days+   and 90 days by the way is for those who are extremely lucky with the lockboxes.Next order of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ttery...  Certain enemy types.  See your armor will break the more that you take damage. Fine right?  WRONG!!! Every faction nearly has that ONE ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t enemy that either has a really cheap homing attack like the bug archers who snipe your ♥♥♥.  The pink missile launching  Volge, or the weird robots that dig their hands into the ground and instantly hit you from wherever you stand.  Once you have a certain amount of damage done unto you, you'll be going down time and time and time and INFURIATING time again. I've never wanted to snap my controller in half more with any other game than this one right here.  There's a difference between challenging and flat out stupid.  Even MLG pro players who obviously cranked out mommy's tax returns still somehow manage to occasionally go down at the hands of end game leveled mobs.  While the game is a scifi free roam MMO shooter, (& that's a huge turn on.)  It utterly FAILS at such basic things. Collision detecting is a big thing. You could be driving along when all of a sudden the SMALLEST lips in the world completely cut off your momentum. Or your vehicle will explode having hit cover near an arkfall! Ever wanted to get COMPLETELY stopped dead in your tracks by running straight into a Stop Sign? Well this is the game for you then! Cause  of all things you would expect to be destructible (signs)  they're not, and if you hit them you come to a complete stop. The driving is just hideous and controls like a 500 lbs. bowling ball!The voice acting and animations I've seen for this are so cheesy. At one point you'll meet a black man who's CLEARLY voiced by a white man, & its just sooo awkward! Awkward infact, is a very accurate word used to describe the campaign which fails to make you give a ♥♥♥♥ about. Even sad moments are just so cheesy you just end up laughing in disgust. These devs are so lazy that they actually take armor THAT YOU PAY FOR from the cash shop and re-color it and offer it to you again either for more money or the less attractive ones can be earned through some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t pursuits. And when I say pursuits I really mean like a LIST, a full blown LIST of things you have to do.  Kill 50,000 enemies? Yeah go ♥♥♥♥ yourself!  The laziness will begin to show even more so when you start side questing and you realize just how many times they re-use and recycle areas.  You'll go back and fourth from one place getting this, talking to this guy, pressing this switch and the combat isn't even enough to keep you interested for the first 10 quests let alone the HUNDREDS. I wouldn't mind fetch questing if there were simply more to do.Arguably the only 2 things the devs did right here is these things called Incursions & Arkfalls. These things are big events you can see going on in your map. It attracts HUNDREDS of players to that area & the sheer chaos is what has kept me addicted. Nowhere ever before have I seen SO many players in one area fighting so many enemies. It's beautiful! It's some of the best war scenes you never seen in games OR movies! The epic scale warfare is so good in fact that the downfall of it all is the last thing about it that's actually positive.   Your guns are all customizable. You can put mods on, upgrade rarity, choose from a massive list of perks. The heavy detail you can go into your powers and how your gun operates is really well done. So well done that its going to show in PvP or PvE & that's the one thing I cannot stand about this game. Absolutely NOTHING amounts to skill.  It's all about your build. If you've gotta good build (which in most cases is paid for) you'll demolish. If not..... Have fun grinding away DAYS of your life trying to get good. What upsets me the most about this game is that the focus is nowhere near where it needs to be. Why does the game have to follow or even be parallel to the events of the show? Why can't it just be a standalone game within the Defiance universe every so often showing a main character.  Instead of investing ANY time at all into a campaign they could have focused their WHOLE game around this awesome principle of uniting hundreds of players and expanded upon it. So fellow Defiance players if you're reading this... Imagine if they had included tanks, jets, or even HALF of the vehicles you SEE parked in the game.  At the very least they could've let your partner (who's riding passenger) lean our the passenger side window and shoot.  Car chases could've been a thing for fetch questing like freaking GTA!  They could've even taken it a step further and had squad leaders determine which contracts (aka quests) to complete and then raid fully detailed buildings instead of what we're left with. (Which is buildings you see.... but can never go into.)   I'm just so tired at the half ♥♥♥ attempt to be a free roam scifi roleplaying shooter.  I salute the devs to be one of the first games to do this next to Firefall & Borderlands, but some of the most basic things you would expect from ANY game are just absent here.  If you attempt to contact the devs stating your gripes, they'll be sure to ignore you and then nerf an exploit that you found to be helpful in your progression. Surely this is why you see ABSOLUTELY NO uploaders on YouTube still covering this game anymore.    My verdict is simple. I won't recommend it (so that explains the thumbs down) but I will say that if you're bored and have nothing else better to do with your life. This can provide you some cheap fun.  I have not a single clue why developers keep making us fight bugs (which is so dumb) but you'll encounter those, zombies, robots, raiders, aliens, religious bigots, and dozens of other poorly voiced characters and factions. It has a sure amount of diversity and the free roam with the inclusion of vehicles is very nice. Just note that this method of rinse and repeat WILL get old. And it will get old VERY quickly...   Good luck Ark Hunter.  You'll need it!

y 8, 2014
												Defiance is a free to play shooter MMO that defines massive CO-OP experience. You can customize weapons and vehicles to help you hunt for alien technology across a transformed Earth. In this game you don't fight alone, you fight with other players, you help each other to fight the monsters and upgrade your equipments.Things I liked:- Gameplay- Graphics- Weapons handling and customization- Free To Play- Big community- Figthing monsters- Vehicles- Singleplayer-ish story mix
